Tomato.planting_season: Spring to early summer (after last frost)
Tomato.tips: Stake or cage plants for support. Prune suckers for larger fruit.

Corn.watering: 1 inch per week, more during tasseling
Corn.spacing: 8-12 inches apart in rows 30-36 inches apart
Corn.tips: Plant in blocks for better pollination. Harvest when kernels are milky.

Wheat.watering: Requires 12-15 inches total during growing season
Wheat.fertilizer: Nitrogen at planting and during spring growth
Wheat.diseases: Rust, powdery mildew, fusarium head blight
Wheat.tips: Harvest when grain moisture is 13-14%. Store properly to prevent mold.

Rice.fertilizer: Split application of NPK, heavy nitrogen
Rice.common_pests: Rice stem borer, leaf folder, planthoppers
Rice.tips: Maintain consistent water level. Drain before harvest.

Potato.planting_season: Early spring (2-4 weeks before last frost)
Potato.spacing: 12 inches apart in rows 30 inches apart
Potato.fertilizer: Low nitrogen, high phosphorus and potassium
Potato.tips: Hill soil around plants as they grow. Harvest when foliage dies back.

Soybean.watering: 1 inch per week, critical during flowering
Soybean.spacing: 2-4 inches apart in rows 30 inches apart
Soybean.fertilizer: Minimal nitrogen (fixes own), phosphorus and potassium
Soybean.diseases: Soybean rust, root rot, mosaic virus
Soybean.tips: Inoculate seeds with rhizobia. Harvest when pods rattle.

Apple.planting_season: Late winter to early spring (dormant season)
Apple.harvest_time: 3-5 years after planting for first harvest
Apple.diseases: Apple scab, fire blight, powdery mildew
Apple.tips: Prune annually. Thin fruit for larger apples. Most varieties need cross-pollination.

Grape.watering: Deep watering weekly, reduce near harvest
Grape.spacing: 6-8 feet between vines in rows 8-10 feet apart
Grape.diseases: Powdery mildew, downy mildew, black rot
Grape.tips: Requires trellising. Prune 80-90% of previous year's growth annually.

Strawberry.spacing: 12-18 inches apart in rows 3-4 feet apart
Strawberry.fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer at planting, then monthly
Strawberry.diseases: Gray mold, leaf spot, verticillium wilt
Strawberry.tips: Mulch with straw. Remove runners for larger berries. Replace plants every 3-4 years.

Pepper.tips: Stake taller varieties. Harvest regularly to encourage production.

Lettuce.sunlight: Partial shade to full sun (prefers cooler temps)
Lettuce.tips: Succession plant every 2 weeks. Harvest in morning for best quality.

Carrot.fertilizer: Low nitrogen, high phosphorus and potassium
Carrot.diseases: Leaf blight, cavity spot, aster yellows
Carrot.tips: Remove rocks from soil. Thin seedlings properly. Harvest when shoulders show color.
